title: Carney Park
text:
Carney Park is a United States military recreational facility located in the <a href="caldera">caldera</a> of Campiglione, in the dormant <a href="volcano">volcano</a> <a href="Mount%20Barbaro">mount Gauro</a>, in the <a href="Phlegraean%20Fields">Phlegraean Fields</a> near <a href="Naples">Naples, Italy</a>. The site is located approximately west of Naples. It is named after <a href="Robert%20Carney">Four Star Admiral Robert B. Carney</a> who served as <a href="Chief%20of%20Naval%20Operations">Chief of Naval Operations</a> during the <a href="Dwight%20D.%20Eisenhower">Eisenhower</a> administration.
History.
The park was established on May 21, 1966 by the <a href="Morale%2C%20Welfare%2C%20and%20Recreation">Morale, Welfare, and Recreation Command</a> (MWR) of the United States Department of Defense. It was originally established and administered by the <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> under the auspices of Naples' Naval Support Activity (NSA). The Morale and Welfare Authority (MWA) of <a href="Allied%20Joint%20Force%20Command%20Naples">AFSOUTH</a>, under the direction of facilities engineer Col. Frank D. McCoy designed and built the nine-hole <a href="golf">golf</a> course in 1969. The golf course and recreational facilities were administered separately from the NSA by AFSOUTH until 1995. At that time, AFSOUTH turned over administration of the golf course to the NSA, thus consolidating the oversight of all resources at the site under the NSA's MWR.
Wildly popular for Overseas Brats, they enjoyed 80s music at the pool, drive in movie theater, and concerts. The best being Cheap Trick in 1984. Other events included Fiesta American where locals could buy lumpia from the Pacific or enjoy Corn on the Cobb from Nebraska.
